item.title: West Side Story, 1961
item.description:
Was I born to dance???

More next week on a very special 70mm podcast.

item.title: Shrek, 2001 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description:
This movie changed my life.

More on a very special bonus 70mm podcast.

item.description: Tim Heidecker is the greatest living comedian.

Brad Bird, ever heard of him?

More next week on a very special 70mm podcast.

item.letterboxd:filmTitle: The 3rd Annual Live 'On Cinema' Oscar Special
item.description: Is Tim Heidecker the greatest living comedian?
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: West Side Story, 1961
item.description:
Can we talk about their clothes or what?

More next week on a very special 70mm podcast.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Don't Panic, 1988 - â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
Could not get over this 17 year old wearing boy's pajamas. Nobody pulled the director aside and asked him wtf?

Needed more weejee board. Time to relisten to the Bat & Spider ep on dis.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Planet of the Apes, 2001 - â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Disastrous.

Tim Roth chewing the scenery so hard there's no sets left. Mark Wahlberg furrows his brow and delivers his lines but that's all he does. Awful.

What was Burton thinking? You can even tell he had anything to do with this movie.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Battle for the Planet of the Apes, 1973 - â˜…â˜…
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: Battle for the Planet of the Apes
item.description:
Even if you assume the bomb that dropped on New York was 10 years before this, the radiation would have been off the charts.. can we please wake up??

These 5 Apes movies came out over the course of 6 years, btw. ðŸ‘€
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Conquest of the Planet of the Apes, 1972 - â˜…â˜…Â½
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: Conquest of the Planet of the Apes
item.description:
Not good.

20 years into the future and everyone wears black turtlenecks. The overall Production Design of "1991" is so bland and uninteresting. Felt like I was looking at the same location over and over for 2 hours.

Main bad guy was a joke and Armando's plan was awful.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Escape from the Planet of the Apes, 1971 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: Escape from the Planet of the Apes
item.description:
An absolute delight.

Borderline camp for half the movie and I ate it up like a juicy hot dog.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Beneath the Planet of the Apes, 1970 - â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
item.description:
Heston looking like he'd aged about 10 years since the first film.

Lotta nonsense in this but the idea of New York being buried underground is awesome. The ending is legit bonkers. I audibly yelled "uhh what??" at my TV.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: The Howling, 1981 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Cripes, that ending!

Also how about that animated werewolf porking scene?
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: The Power, 2021 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description: Corrina Faith, I will follow you.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Demons, 1985 - â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description: The music and gore was nice.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: The McPherson Tape, 1989 - â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description:
This feels like it would have won best in class at my local community college 35 years back.

Not Very Good but my wife and I had fun. Bonkers to me they the idea of a found footage movie was a full 10 years before Blair Witch.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai, 1957 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: The Bridge on the River Kwai
item.description:
Is this greatest climax in in the history of film? Wtf.

I wish I'd seen this years ago to truly appreciate the 4K DOLBY VISION version. Watching this on VHS/DVD and then going to a pristine edish would probably blow my dad's mind. There are some oddball flaws in the transfer specifically during transitions that I actually love.

This is one of those long "classics" that you need to really buckle up for and enjoy the whole ride. Lots of long conversations and slow scenic moments. The many layers about war are obv amazing which led to a finale that legit knocked my socks off.

Proto, thank you.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Solo: A Star Wars Story, 2018 - â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
Dryden Vos is the best-dressed character in the history of Star Wars.

More next week on a very special 70mm podcast.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Planet of the Apes, 1968 - â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
Man is the monster, etc etc.

Heston's acting at times is absolutely mental. That laugh he delivers after razzing his fellow astronaut is completely insane. This probably would have rocked as a Twilight Zone two-parter. Also the instant you see a horse should be the instant you realize you're on Earth, my guy. Also everyone was speaking ENGLISH.

Homer going into space and Troy McClure singing is my Planet of the Apes.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Bad Trip, 2021 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description: Make me belly laugh and I'm yours.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Violation, 2020 - â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description: Nope.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: The 2nd Annual Live 'On Cinema' Oscar Special, 2014 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: The 2nd Annual Live 'On Cinema' Oscar Special
item.description:
Could not breathe when he told Gregg that everyone laughs at him behind his back.

Tim Heidecker is the greatest living comedian.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Ali, 2001 - â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Watching this so soon after Spike Lee's Malcolm X certainly didn't do it any favors, imo.

Did not like Ali the person enough to spend nearly 3 hours of him basically being a jerk to everyone around him.

More on a very special 70mm podcast.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: A Hidden Life, 2019 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
Better to suffer injustice then to do it.

Yowza, extremely bold filmmaking.

I was absolutely beside myself with the wide lens usage throughout the entire movie. I Googled the details so fast my phone almost flew out of my hand.

I don't think I've ever seen a movie shot like this before.

Terrance, I'm yours.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Arcade, 1993 - â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
If I saw this on PHL17 growing up this would have been my favorite movie of all-time.

The final act and special effects are an absolute sight. Am I tracking down the VHS for this rn?

Looking forward to my bois at www.batandspider.com talking about this.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Badlands, 1973 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Sure was swell to look at.

How about that scubmbag move in the fields by Sissy Spacek's dad? Wtf.

Really wanted to give Martin Sheen a wedgie for the entire movie.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: The 1st Annual Live 'On Cinema' Oscar Special, 2013 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: The 1st Annual Live 'On Cinema' Oscar Special
item.description: Gregg's reaction to The Hobbit not winning is the stuff of legend.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Communion, 1989 - â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Not good.

The alien stuff was embarrassing and it felt like there were too many (bad) improv scenes kept in the movie. Horrific editing.

Eric Clapton composed the score for some reason.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Event Horizon, 1997 - â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
I remember sneaking into the theater when I was 14 to see this and a love affair with horror was born.

The idea of a space program creating an artificial black hole in a ship for space travel and accidentally reaching "Hell" is solid gold, imo. Gosh it's gold. Would love a modern remake.

The blood orgy was extremely formative.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Malibu Express, 1985 - â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Written and directed by the horniest 12 year old in human history.

Still can't believe I saw a red Delorean.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Godzilla vs. Kong, 2021 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description: EFF YES DUDE.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Speed Racer, 2008 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Am I high rn?

More on a very special 70mm podcast.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Harakiri, 1962 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description: Wtf, this is incredible.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Female Prisoner 701: Scorpion, 1972 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
The hype is extremely real.

That shot in the showers of the one girl lunging at Nami with the glass sent me into a cinematic fugue state.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Prince of Darkness, 1987 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
Officially my fave Carpenter.

Like come on; shady catholicism, captured essence of satan hidden under a church, brainy dweebs brought in by their teacher to help study the captured evil, and dream messages from the future. What more could I want? Obv not perfect but it has all the pieces for me.

Grabbed the Shout Factory 4K and it sure looks swell. Mind boggling that this hasn't been remade in some form.

Jordan Peele pls.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Enter the Dragon, 1973 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Bruce Lee's body, my god.

Also this has more ball-shots than an episode of America's Funniest Home Videos.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Assault on Precinct 13, 1976 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description: John Carpenter is the greatest composer in the history of film.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: King Kong, 1933 - â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Robert Armstrong as Carl Denham is absolutely catastrophic. Technical prowess aside, I was completely bored and eye rolling seeing these goober actors on-screen.

More on a very special 70mm podcast.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: At Close Range, 1986 - â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
Walken's hair, eff me.

Have zero recollection of why I even put this on my watchlist but the cast in this thing is completely absurd.

Sean Penn was with Madonna around this time and "Live to Tell" plays a ton during this movie. It's the very first credit at the end of the movie!

Song is legit so I didn't mind.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Plan 9 from Outer Space, 1957 - â˜…â˜…
item.description: Not good.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Hobson's Choice, 1954 - â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
Willie's hair on another level.

Brenda De Banzie nearing 50 but playing a 30 year old GET IT GIRL. Eat shit, Mank.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Unstoppable, 2010 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description: Tony Scott DA GAWD.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Batman Forever, 1995 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Dr. Chase Meridian is the horniest woman in the history of cinema.

More on a very special Patron-only 70mm podcast.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Ganja & Hess, 1973 - â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
How about that dude's hog towards the end? Mama mia.

Hesitant to even leave a rating just because it almost didn't even feel like a "movie." Def experimental in a way that A24 dweebs would absolutely throb over today. My god the buzz would be endless. People buying $70 Ganja & Hess t-shirts from Supreme.

Ready to finish listening to the Bat and Spider bois talk about this.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Zack Snyder's Justice League, 2021 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Stunned, tbh.

Formally apologizing to Zack Snyder for wanting him gone after that dreadful BvS. I'm fully ready for a Knightmare experience, even though it sounds like it's officially over for him and DC. That Flash scene at the end got me real good.

More on a very special 70mm podcast.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker, 1982 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½
item.description:
Why don't more people talk about this movie??

Is it the fact that is has such a strange title? Up until the halfway point I thought it was called Butcher Baker: Nightmare Maker.

I'm guessing it the horrible cop character, holy shit what a prick! Unreal opening sequence.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: A History of Violence, 2005 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description:
Man alive, that stairwell scene. You could write a book on the layers to that scene and I'd buy a print copy.

Couldn't stand the son's sub-plot, and his reaction to the reveal had cringey dialog. I took a look at Cronenberg's filmography right before and since this movie and boy howdy what an odd mix. Who knew he had done two movies with Robert Pattinson?

William Hurt's facial hair is an abomination.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice, 2016 - â˜…â˜…Â½
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
item.description: From the brilliant mind that wrote The Rise of Skywalker.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: The Monster Club, 1981
item.description:
Fell into a twitter rabbit hole about Substack moderation and the doxxing of female reporters during the first 25 minutes of this but I caught the middle story and thought it was v cute.

My wife slept through the whole thing.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: Mission: Impossible III, 2006 - â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…
item.description:
I feel a deep sadness for people that don't love Tom Cruise movies.

More on a very special podcast with old friends.
item.dc:creator: slim

item.title: 70mm - Podcast Setlist
item.description:
UPDATE ->>
For an updated version of this list, click this and check out the official 70mmpod Letterboxd!
UPDATE ->>

Finally, a podcast about movies. Each week famous artist Danny Haas, poet/writer Protolexus, and journeyman podcaster Slim discuss a recently watched film together. Their love for each other cannot be broken. Or can it?

item.title: Faves - 2017
item.description:
Hi. Here are my fave movies from 2017. Not necessarily released in 2017, but more that I saw it for the first time in 2017.

LOGAN wins out unconditionally. I just watched it again today. You still have time. I still have time. We all still have time. I cried making this list.

LAST JEDI is still fresh in my mind. Kylo, I'm here for your journey. I am rooting for you. I'm rooting for me. We still have time.

Goodbye, 2017.

  • 10 Cloverfield Lane
  • Arrival
  • The Fog
  • Get Out
  • Green Room
  • It Comes at Night
  • Logan
  • Marjoe
  • Star Wars: The Last Jedi
  • Thor: Ragnarok

...plus 2 more. View the full list on Letterboxd.
item.dc:creator: slim
